page.title: 14THE CHURCH AT SHARDLOW
page.content: The church at Shardlow was built in 1838 by Thomas Cooper of Derby, three years after the graveyard. Before that a church boat went along the canal taking services and taking people to Aston church. The church cost Â£4285 including six bells. The organ was presented by Mr. Sutton of Shardlow Hall. In 1839 the church was dedicated by the Lord Bishop of Ripon. Now the church is used at 9am and 6pm on Sunday. The vicar is Rev. Harding. The organist is Mrs. Cook. A group of bell ringers meet on Tuesday and play before each service. Elvaston church was built in the 1200's. The services take place at 10:15am. At other times it is open for visitors who may go on a guided tour of the church to see the monuments etc. The warden is Mrs. Cooper.
